text: sixgill is a provider of sensor
ingestion services we take data from
sensors make edge level decision
services and then store the data in the
backend for analytics purposes by
leveraging the next-generation
technologies that are available through
AWS and through scale arc we're
essentially able to increase our system
performance by hundreds of percent and
handle far more queries with the same
basic infrastructure cost six skills
customers are large entities that are
collecting information about their
customer and their customers customers
behaviors we're in a competitive IOT
market and I think the expectation is
that we're going to have something on
the order of a trillion sensors in 10 or
20 years so somebody's got to process
all this sensor ingestion our system
currently has enabled on about 50
million devices would generate about 3
terabytes of data per day we had
scalability issues primarily because of
our reliance on sequel databases so we
really wanted a load balancing service
that could sit in front of it since we
were already running on AWS we tried to
find AWS affiliated companies and
partners that would provide us a
solution to this problem so we took a
look and found a company called scale
Ark and we were really happy with what
they provided and scale Ark has a
terrific load balancing service that
allows you to continue to scale out the
underlying databases but also deals with
any underlying platform challenges I
have is something available that we
could initiate and instantiate and
leverage meant that we could solve our
problem immediately the skylark
infrastructure essentially moves
requests across different database
instances and as a result we can scale
to ways we can have scale Ark instances
that queue and handle processes and we
can also load more database services on
the backend for take advantage of it can
address even the capacity management
underneath from a data perspective while
offering us a centralized interface into
our system so we don't have to change
our code
order to leverage more services and
capabilities in the backend sixgill
benefits by running at scale Arkin AWS
because we can deploy quickly we can
scale quickly and that allows us to meet
the needs that we have of deploying and
ingesting information from sensors and
different locations with different
densities around the world I don't have
to be in a position to go provision
things and have to rewrite my
application components to work with some
back-end changes the backend changes can
happen independently to give me benefits
right away without me actually having to
rewrite any code our customers win
through our technology choices of
leveraging AWS and leveraging scaler by
having low cost environment to ingest
all the information they have and be
able to process it effectively and that
gives us a great match with our
customers
